❖ 8mm eyes for amigurumi ❖ dark green yarn…… medium #4 worsted ❖ fiberfill stuffing size 12-15 yards 7g ❖ stitch marker ❖ white yarn medium #4 worsted size ❖ yarn needle 3-4 yards 1g ❖ yellow yarn……… light #3 dk size 10-12 yards 5g the yarn i used and that s pictured is bernat super value acrylic in colors taupe deep sea green winter white and i used bernat baby sport in the color baby yellow the amount of yarn necessary varies if you use different size yarn or hook than the pattern and also depending on your gauge this pattern can be made in almost any size yarn adjust your hook size for stitches to repeat the indicated decrease…… decrease invisible amount of times decrease x1…… the necessary amount of times to st…… stitch or stitches repeat a sequence of stitches space…… space fasten_off…… cut the working yarn and pull through the loop and pull tight chain…… chain when the pattern says turn usually additional information is in after chaining that means stop and colored parenthesis work the piece going in the opposite direction note when a row has a color at the beginning of a row - that s the yarn color for that row/round and the following row until a color change is indicated to change colors for single_crochet insert hook into next stitch yarn over and pull up a loop there should be 2 loops in the hook yarn over with new color and pull through both loops and continue pattern make sure to keep the gauge tight for both yarns during the color change so the stitch isn t loose when crocheting in the round crochet in continuous rounds without a slip_stitch + chain at the beginning of each round simply end each round with single_crochet or whatever stitch is indicated for the pattern and move the stitch marker up and continue note instructions for sewing
